description: Provides functionality for elements that can be clicked.

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the element is clicked.

ret.doc: The element to which the event handler was added.

docs.summary: Adds an event handler that runs when the element is clicked.
description: An element receives a `click` event when a user clicks on the element
When a user double-clicks an element, two `click` events are fired
before a `doubleClick` event is also fired.
You can also define an event handler using the Properties panel.
This will automatically add the required code for the selected element and event:
//Add your code for this event here:
Learn more about adding event handlers to your code by using the [Properties panel](https://support.wix.com/en/article/corvid-reacting-to-user-actions-using-events).

examples.title: Get the ID of the element that was clicked

notes: Do not use the Editor Link panel to redirect on click when a link is already defined using the `onClick()` function. To avoid unpredictable behavior, remove the link from the Editor Link panel. **Deprecation note:** The $w parameter of event handlers is being deprecated. To get a scoped selector for working with elements in repeater items, use the [$w.at()]($w.html#at) function and pass it the context property of the event parameter: `$item = $w.at(event.context)`. To learn more, see here.

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the element is clicked.

ret.doc: The element to which the event handler was added.

docs.summary: Adds an event handler that runs when the element is double-clicked.
description: An element receives a `dblClick` event when a user double-clicks on the element
When a user double-clicks an element, two `click` events are fired
before a `doubleClick` event is also fired.
You can also define an event handler using the Properties panel.
Learn more about adding event handlers to your code by using the [Properties panel](https://support.wix.com/en/article/corvid-reacting-to-user-actions-using-events).

examples.title: Get the ID of the element that was double-clicked

notes: **Deprecation note:** The $w parameter of event handlers is being deprecated. To get a scoped selector for working with elements in repeater items, use the [$w.at()]($w.html#at) function and pass it the context property of the event parameter: `$item = $w.at(event.context)`. To learn more, see here.
